affiliations.supporting_quote: In 2007, she also became a member of The Elders, a group founded by Nelson Mandela and Graça Machel and led by Archbishop Desmond Tutu.
She is member of the board of the United Nations Foundation.

affiliations.supporting_quote: Recently, Brundtland served on the United Nation’s Panel on Threats, Challenges, and Change.

affiliations.organization: World Commission on the Environment and Development (Brundtland Commission)
affiliations.supporting_quote: In the 1980s she chaired the World Commission on the Environment and Development―the Brundtland Commission established the concept of sustainable development in its landmark report, Our Common Future.

affiliations.organization: United Nations Special Envoys for Climate Change
affiliations.supporting_quote: Brundtland served as one of three United Nations Special Envoys for Climate Change, having been named to that position in May of 2007 by U.N. Secretary General Ban Ki-moon.

awards.award: Scientific American’s Policy Leader of the Year
awards.supporting_quote: She also succeeded in garnering support for the first negotiated agreement on a major public health issue, The Tobacco Convention, and was recognized that same year as Scientific American’s ‘Policy Leader of the Year.’
perhaps her most prized award is the unofficial title she holds in her native Norway, where she is affectionately known as ‘Landsmoderen’ or ‘mother of the nation.’

affiliations.supporting_quote: In The Elders, Brundtland has served as Deputy Chair and taken an active role in initiatives such as combating child marriage.
Brundtland is also a member of the Council of Women World Leaders, a group that concerns itself with female health, sexual violence, and other issues related to women’s well-being.
As a member of the Club of Madrid, she is involved in efforts to promote and build democratic institutions around the world.

affiliations.organization: UN Special Envoy on Climate Change
affiliations.supporting_quote: In 2007 she was appointed by the UN Secretary General to serve as a Special Envoy on Climate Change along with Han Seung-soo, former foreign minister of South Korea, and Ricardo Lagos, former president of Chile.
